linkable_points: Miami-Dade County Ordinance 22-83 effective January 1, 2023 prohibits conventional Type 1 septic systems for new installations, requiring Type 2, Type 3, or Type 4 systems instead
New septic system installation in Miami-Dade typically costs $8,000-$25,000 depending on system type, size, site conditions, and installation complexity
Installation process requires site evaluation, soil testing, permit approval from DERM, professional design, licensed contractor installation, and final inspection before use
New systems must maintain minimum 100 feet from surface water bodies, 50 feet from property lines, and drainfield bottom must be 36 inches above wet season high water table
All new installations require prior written approval from Miami-Dade DERM Director, site plan, building plan, and site evaluation results before construction can begin
Site evaluation includes soil percolation testing, soil composition analysis, property boundary assessment, and environmental sensitivity evaluation by licensed professionals
Installation timeline typically takes 2-6 months from initial site evaluation through final approval, depending on application completeness and site complexity
Professional installation by licensed contractors is required, though owner-occupied single-family homes may have exemptions while still requiring permits and inspections
